commands.name: Query Service Configuration
commands.description: Query detailed service configuration information on Windows including start type, binary path, and service dependencies

variables.name: <SERVICE_NAME>
variables.description: Name of the Windows service to query

flag_explanations.qc: Query configuration - displays service configuration details

commands.notes:
Extracted from instruction text:
'Manual check with:
sc qc <servicename>'.

Used to manually verify service configuration details during privilege escalation enumeration.

commands.name: Check Nmap Version
commands.description: Verify installed nmap version to determine available features and capabilities

flag_explanations.--version: Display version information and compilation details

commands.notes:
Extracted from instruction text:
'Check nmap version:
nmap --version (if < 5.21, interactive works)'.

Nmap versions prior to 5.21 support interactive mode which can be exploited for privilege escalation via sudo.

commands.name: Extract Strings from Binary
commands.description: Extract printable character sequences from binary files to identify hardcoded credentials, file paths, or function names

variables.name: <BINARY_PATH>
variables.description: Path to binary file to analyze

flag_explanations.strings: Default behavior extracts sequences of 4+ printable characters

commands.notes:
Extracted from instruction text:
'Manual binary analysis:
strings /path/to/binary'.

Common technique for analyzing SUID binaries, identifying library dependencies, or finding embedded credentials.

commands.name: Check Specific Binary Capabilities
commands.description: Query Linux capabilities assigned to a specific binary for privilege escalation analysis

variables.name: <BINARY_PATH>
variables.description: Path to binary to check for capabilities

commands.notes:
Extracted from instruction text:
'Check specific binary:
getcap /usr/bin/python3 (test known binary)'.

Verifies if a known binary has capabilities that could be exploited for privilege escalation.

commands.name: Manual LDAP DN Path Inspection
commands.description: Manually inspect LDAP distinguished name paths to identify user and group container locations

variables.name: <LDAP_OUTPUT_FILE>
variables.description: File containing LDAP query output with DN paths

commands.notes:
Extracted from instruction text:
'Manual check:
Look for 'CN=Users' or 'CN=Groups' in DN path'.

Used to manually verify LDAP query results and identify organizational structure in Active Directory environments.

commands.name: Inspect AD User Attributes
commands.description: Extract and display description, info, and comment attributes from Active Directory user objects that may contain credentials or sensitive information
commands.notes:
Extracted from instruction text:
'Manual attribute inspection:
$script:AllUsers[-1].Properties | select description,info,comment'.

PowerShell command to inspect specific attributes of AD user objects, often containing passwords or sensitive notes.

commands.name: Verify PowerView Module Path
commands.description: Check loaded PowerView module path and version information to verify correct module is loaded
commands.notes:
Extracted from instruction text:
'Check module path:
(Get-Module PowerView).Path | Select-String -Pattern 'version''.

Verifies PowerView module is correctly imported and identifies which version is active.

commands.name: Enumerate All Extended Rights
commands.description: Filter Active Directory ACLs to find all objects with ExtendedRight permissions including ForceChangePassword capability

flag_explanations.?: PowerShell alias for Where-Object to filter results

commands.notes:
Extracted from instruction text:
'Check for AllExtendedRights (includes ForceChangePassword):
Get-ObjectAcl | ? {$_.ActiveDirectoryRights -match 'ExtendedRight'}'.

Identifies objects where current user has extended rights that may allow password changes or other privileged operations.

commands.name: Enumerate ACLs by Security Identifier
commands.description: Query Active Directory object ACLs filtered by specific security identifier to find permissions current user has on target

variables.name: <TARGET>
variables.description: Target AD object (user, group, computer, or OU)

variables.name: <YOUR_SID>
variables.description: Security Identifier (SID) of current user or group

commands.notes:
Extracted from instruction text:
'Manual enumeration:
Get-ObjectAcl -Identity <TARGET> | ? {$_.SecurityIdentifier -eq <YOUR_SID>}'.

Manually enumerate specific ACL permissions current user has on target object to identify privilege escalation paths.

commands.name: Retrieve robots.txt File
commands.description: Request robots.txt file from web server to discover hidden directories and files excluded from search engine indexing

variables.name: <TARGET>
variables.description: Target web server hostname or IP address

commands.notes:
Extracted from instruction text:
'Check robots.txt first:
curl http://<TARGET>/robots.txt'.

First step in web reconnaissance to identify potentially sensitive directories and files before directory brute forcing.

commands.name: Test for Rate Limiting
commands.description: Test web application for rate limiting controls using small wordlist before full brute force attempt

flag_explanations.--hc: Hide responses with specific HTTP status code

commands.notes:
Extracted from instruction text:
'Check for rate limiting:
Test with small wordlist first'.

Proactive check to avoid account lockout or IP banning before attempting full password brute force attack.

troubleshooting.429 status codes: Rate limiting detected - use slower attack with --req-delay or manual attempts
troubleshooting.Account lockout messages: Reduce request rate, increase delay between attempts
troubleshooting.IP blocking: Use proxy rotation or VPN to change source IP
